results.title: Ray of hope
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed for use in a national campaign against tuberculosis, this film describes the disease and preventive measures being taken to eradicate the disease from Australia. Shows the use of chest X-ray in detecting the disease; symptoms, nature and spread of tuberculosis; treatment of patients at sanatorium; importance of keeping children free from infection; use of BCG vaccine for the immunization of school children.

results.title: Postcard from Perth
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Perth, far removed from the main centres of Austraian life and industry, is a quiet and peaceful city [1954]. Folks relax and do not seem to hurry. This film reflects somewhat, the leisure and and activities of the people of Perth in the 1950s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The New Ipswich
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: The story of the way of life of the people in Ipswich, Queensland. Scenes include: the Alan Cunnigham memorial (explorer) railway workshop, woollen mill, timber mill and coal mines, schools and leisure activities. Music by Robert Hughes.

results.title: Brisbane: city in the sun
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the pattern of life in Brisbane, Queensland. Aspects such as commerce, tourist appeal and the social pastimes of locals and tourists are depicted. Includes views of the races, the beach and Brisbane River. Camera: Edward Cranstone Sound: Donald Kennedy Music: Don Andrews

results.title: City in the sun
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Loch and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Inspired by Arne Sucksdorff’s “Manniskor i Stad” (Rhythm of a city), this film reflects the mood of a day in the life of Sydney, New South Wales, from morning until night.

results.title: Cooee
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In 1915, the Australian Land Army marched on the Cooee trail from the mid-western farming town of Gilgandra to Sydney, gathering volunteer troops for the Dardanelles on the way. In 1987, a new band of “Cooees” set off to re-enact the march. The film’s production crew were involved from the march’s planning stage. This record of the re-enactment covering the 550 km from Gilgandra to the Sydney Town Hall not only provides a portrait of the individuals involved but also gives a glimpse of the mood and attitudes of rural Australia, 1987.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Chase, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia

results.title: They used to call it sandy blight
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: Designed to reveal the problem of trachoma and other serious eye diseases common in remote First Nations communities. Health problems, housing and general living conditions are also looked at. Shows how medical attention can help to alleviate problems.

results.title: Women 88
results.brief_description: Women ‘88 is a series of seven five minute films. The series was produced for the Women’s Program Bicentennial Authority and celebrates and promotes the past and present quality of Australian Women’s achievement, so as to inspire pride in, and respect for, their diverse contributions to the evolution of Australian society.

results.title: Sounds Like Australia
results.brief_description: A superbly crafted film that brings you the unique sounds of the Australian bush. It interweaves the songs of our rare birds - The Victorian Rifle, Lyrebird and the Emu among others, with music that celebrates the Australian landscape and its wildlife…the sounds of Australia.
